titleStmt.title: Three proper, and wittie, familiar letters: lately passed betvveene tvvo vniuersitie men: touching the earthquake in Aprill last, and our English refourmed versifying With the preface of a wellwiller to them both.
titleStmt.author: Spenser, Edmund, 1552?-1599.

editionStmt.edition: This text is an enriched version of the TCP digital transcription A12787 of text S111268 in the English Short Title Catalog (STC 23095). Textual changes and metadata enrichments aim at making the text more computationally tractable, easier to read, and suitable for network-based collaborative curation by amateur and professional end users from many walks of life. The text has been tokenized and linguistically annotated with MorphAdorner. The annotation includes standard spellings that support the display of a text in a standardized format that preserves archaic forms ('loveth', 'seekest'). Textual changes aim at restoring the text the author or stationer meant to publish.

respStmt.resp: This text has not been fully proofread

fileDesc.extent: Approx. 126 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 33 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal . The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

Harvey, Gabriel, 1550?-1631. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: By H. Bynneman, dvvelling in Thames streate, neere vnto Baynardes Castell,

notesStmt.note: The letters signed "Immerito", i.e. Edmund Spenser, and "G.H.", i.e. Gabriel Harvey.
At foot of title: Cum gratia & priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
"Tvvo other, very commendable letters, of the same mens vvriting" has separate dated title page; pagination and register are continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.

keywords.term: English poetry -- Early modern, 1500-1700 -- History and criticism -- Early works to 1800.
